text: The Shawshank Redemption (1994) - Director: Frank Darabont. A wrongly convicted banker forms a friendship in prison and clings to hope over decades. Often ranked among the greatest films of all time.
The Godfather (1972) - Director: Francis Ford Coppola. A crime family saga about power, loyalty, and succession. Landmark in American cinema.
The Godfather Part II (1974) - Director: Francis Ford Coppola. Parallel stories of Vito Corleone's rise and Michael's reign. Celebrated for scope and depth.
The Dark Knight (2008) - Director: Christopher Nolan. Batman faces the Joker in a moral and psychological showdown. Known for its intense performances and scale.
12 Angry Men (1957) - Director: Sidney Lumet. A jury deliberation turns into a study of bias and reasonable doubt. Classic courtroom drama.
Schindler's List (1993) - Director: Steven Spielberg. A haunting account of the Holocaust and one man's efforts to save lives. Widely honored for its impact.
The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King (2003) - Director: Peter Jackson. The epic conclusion to the trilogy, known for its scale and awards.
Pulp Fiction (1994) - Director: Quentin Tarantino. Interwoven crime stories with sharp dialogue and nonlinear storytelling. A defining 1990s film.
The Good, the Bad and the Ugly (1966) - Director: Sergio Leone. A sprawling spaghetti western about three men chasing buried gold. Iconic score and cinematography.
Fight Club (1999) - Director: David Fincher. A disillusioned narrator forms an underground fight club that spirals into chaos. Known for its twist and themes.
Forrest Gump (1994) - Director: Robert Zemeckis. A simple man unwittingly influences historic events. Beloved for its heart and performances.
Inception (2010) - Director: Christopher Nolan. A team enters dreams to steal and implant ideas. Famous for its layered structure and visuals.
The Matrix (1999) - Director: Lana and Lilly Wachowski. A hacker discovers reality is a simulation and joins a rebellion. Revolutionary action and concept.
Goodfellas (1990) - Director: Martin Scorsese. A rise and fall of a mob associate. Known for its pacing, narration, and authenticity.
Star Wars: Episode V - The Empire Strikes Back (1980) - Director: Irvin Kershner. The Rebels face a major setback as the saga deepens. Often considered the best in the series.
Parasite (2019) - Director: Bong Joon Ho. A darkly comic thriller about class divide and deception. First non-English Best Picture winner.
The Silence of the Lambs (1991) - Director: Jonathan Demme. An FBI trainee seeks help from a serial killer to catch another. A tense psychological thriller.
Seven Samurai (1954) - Director: Akira Kurosawa. Farmers hire ronin to defend their village. A foundational epic in world cinema.
City of God (2002) - Director: Fernando Meirelles and Katia Lund. A gripping look at crime in Rio de Janeiro's favelas. Known for its energy and realism.
The Green Mile (1999) - Director: Frank Darabont. A prison guard encounters a mysterious inmate with supernatural gifts. Emotional drama set on death row.
